titles.title: To extend the Undertaking Spam, Spyware, And Fraud Enforcement With Enforcers beyond Borders Act of 2006, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Commerce, Manufacturing, and Trade.
Reported by the Committee on Energy and Commerce. H. Rept. 112-653.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 471.

action.text: Mrs. Bono Mack moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6131.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

calendar.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 507.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 11/14/2012--Passed Senate without amendment. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.) Repeals, effective September 30, 2020, the Undertaking Spam, Spyware, And Fraud Enforcement With Enforcers beyond Borders Act of 2006 (U.S. SAFE WEB Act of 2006).
